p: Informal trade or sharing of cassava planting material, which may carry the pathogen, is important to subsistence growers as a cheap means of obtaining what is otherwise perceived to be superior material. Informal trade or sourcing of stem cuttings (here considered to refer to any form of movement of material between growers) is difficult to regulate, but the movement of infected material through this trade is thought to be important in long-distance pathogen dispersal [ 11].
